Package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.annotations

Annotation Interface CellFilter

@Retention(RUNTIME) @Target(FIELD) public @interface CellFilter
Indicates that the annotated field should be used as a filterable column or property in a table. When this annotation is present, the table logic will apply filtering logic based on the associated type() and componentType().

Typical usage involves annotating a field within a row model class to specify which UI component (e.g., a text input, dropdown) is responsible for filtering that column. The table framework then retrieves this information at runtime (via reflection) to execute the proper filtering actions.

Where InputComponentType is an enum or class implementing ComponentType, and TEXT_INPUT is one of its constants.

The filtering mechanism is typically performed by a TableFilter implementation, which uses the specified component type to determine how to filter table rows based on user-provided input or predefined values.

This annotation is processed at runtime, and the table logic uses it alongside other annotations (e.g., CellInsertion) to build a complete picture of how each field in a row model should be handled.

  • Required Element Summary

    Required Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Required Element
    Description
    String
    componentType
    Defines the component type identifier (e.g., an enum constant or string) to distinguish which specific filter mechanism to apply.
    Class<? extends ComponentType>
    type
    Specifies the UI component type (e.g., an enum or class implementing ComponentType) that will handle filtering for this field.

  • Element Details

    • type

      Class<? extends ComponentType> type
      Specifies the UI component type (e.g., an enum or class implementing ComponentType) that will handle filtering for this field.
      Returns:
      the class representing the component type.

    • componentType

      String componentType
      Defines the component type identifier (e.g., an enum constant or string) to distinguish which specific filter mechanism to apply.
      Returns:
      a string matching a known component type identifier.
